definition: horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
tail/remainder/remnant/extremity/sixth of the 28 constellations/classifier for fish
horse's tail/pointed posterior section of a locust etc

sentences.english: There is a bow at the end of the ponytail.
sentences.chinese: 在马尾辫末尾变成躬行。

sentences.english: I usually tie them a horsetail plait.
sentences.chinese: 我经常把它们扎成马尾辫。

sentences.english: Tara, 37, has a blond ponytail and huge blue eyes.
sentences.chinese: 塔拉37岁，金色马尾辫，大大的蓝眼睛。

sentences.english: You can rather try ponytail or a headband.
sentences.chinese: 试试扎个马尾辫或头巾会比较好。

sentences.english: In the list of banned styles are included ponytails, mullets and elaborate spikes。
sentences.chinese: 受到禁止的发型包括马尾辫，长发，大波浪头。

sentences.english: The snappers started nibbling at my ponytail, they had never seen humans.
sentences.chinese: 甲鱼开始啃我的马尾辫，之前他们从未见过人类。

sentences.english: Long enough for a ponytail with swing to it.
sentences.chinese: 长到能够扎起来回摇摆的马尾辫。

sentences.english: Song combs along horse's tail pigtail continuously to tow to the shoulder on.
sentences.chinese: 小宋老师梳着一条长长的马尾辫一直拖到肩头上。

sentences.english: Ponytails are out but side-partings and Elvis quiffs are in.
sentences.chinese: 马尾辫“过时”，偏分头和短发受推崇。

sentences.english: I want pigtails, not a ponytail.
sentences.chinese: 我想扎辫子，不要马尾辫。

definition: Mawei district of Fuzhou city 福州市[Fu2 zhou1 shi4], Fujian
ponytail (hairstyle)/horse's tail/slender fibers like horse's tail (applies to various plants)
level with one's shoulders/(of two people) both the same height
pigtail/(fig.) a shortcoming or evidence of wrongdoing that can be seized upon by others
hair worn in a bun or coil
